head.title: POSTINGS: For People in Princeton; Indoor Team Sports Center

hedline.hl1: POSTINGS: For People in Princeton; Indoor Team Sports Center

block.p: A developer has won approvals to build a major indoor recreation complex at College Park, next to the Princeton Forrestal Center in Princeton, N.J.

The developer, National Business Parks, an affiliate of Lawrence Zirinsky Associates, a Manhattan real estate company, is seeking an operator and joint-venturer to build the 21,000-square-foot dome, which would be made available to corporations in the Princeton area.
A developer has won approvals to build a major indoor recreation complex at College Park, next to the Princeton Forrestal Center in Princeton, N.J.

The developer, National Business Parks, an affiliate of Lawrence Zirinsky Associates, a Manhattan real estate company, is seeking an operator and joint-venturer to build the 21,000-square-foot dome, which would be made available to corporations in the Princeton area.
"There is not another area in the entire country which is available to corporations for basketball and other team sports," said Tim Tomai, president of National Business Parks.

The complex, which would take about four months to build, would cost about $1.2 million. It will have advanced heating and cooling systems, locker rooms and on-site parking. The architect is the Northeast Design Group of Mount Laurel, N.J.
College Park is a joint venture of Lawrence Zirinsky Associates and Pocantico Development, both of Manhattan. National Business Parks is the operating arm of Zirinsky Associates.
